CV

Education

2004–2009: Goethe University, Frankfurt, Germany

Ph.D. (Finance), Essays on Market Frictions and Model Misspecification in Asset Pricing

2001-2004: Goethe University, Frankfurt, Germany

Diplom Kaufmann’ (M.S. equivalent, Business Administration) - major: Finance, minor: Econometrics

2003-2004: Goethe University, Frankfurt, Germany

Additional courses completed at the Department of Mathematics: - alculus I & II, Linear Algebra I & II, Introduction to Stochastics, Stochastic Processes

1999-2001: Goethe University, Frankfurt, Germany

German ‘Vordiplom’ (B.S. equivalent, Business Administration)

Academic Experience

2019-present: Associate Professor of Finance

VU Amsterdam, SBE, Finance department

2012-2019: Assistant Professor of Finance (tenured since 2017)

VU Amsterdam, SBE, Finance department

2016-present: Visiting scholar

Dutch National Bank (DNB)

2014-present: Visiting scholar

Columbia Business School, regular visiting scholar, faculty sponsor Prof. Michael Johannes

2009-2012: Assistant Professor of Finance

Swiss Institute of Banking and Finance, s/bfs

2004-2009: Research Assistant

Goethe University, Frankfurt, Derivatives and Financial Engineering Group, Professor Christian Schlag
